page.title: 07KINGSKERSWELL/ QUARRIES
page.content: Stoneycombe Quarry is situated 1 mile south west of Kingskerswell village. It covers a total area of about 300 acres. Commercial quarrying was started by a local family called Mills in 1893. ECC QUARRIES LTD., took over in 1957. Grey/pink Limestone(Calcium Carbonate) is extracted by drilling and blasting.Then it is crushed and graded into materials used in the road building and construction industry; in bitumen Macadam for road surfacing, in the production of concrete and as ground Limestone which is used in the agricultural industry as an acidity neutralizer. The plant has a prodution capabilty of 750.000 tonnes perannum.The extraction area ranges from 95 metres above sea level to 30 metres above sea level at the lowest point where extraction is currently taking place.
